FUNCTION int_to_bin(n) RESULT(bin_str)
  INTEGER, INTENT(IN) :: n
  CHARACTER(LEN=80) :: bin_str
  INTEGER :: i, len
  bin_str = ''
  IF (n == 0) THEN
    bin_str = '0'
    RETURN
  END IF
  DO i = 1, 80
    bin_str(i:i) = '0' + MOD(n,2)
    n = n / 2
    IF (n == 0) EXIT
  END DO
  ! Reverse the string
  len = LEN_TRIM(bin_str) bin_str = REVERSE(bin_str(1:len))

children.text:
Now, the code structure:

PROGRAM main

IMPLICIT NONE

INTEGER :: a, b, res, x, prime_result

INTEGER(8) :: value_second_step

! Read a and b

READ *, a, b

! First step: compute res

res = a

DO

   IF (a < b) EXIT

   res = res + a / b

   a = (a / b) + MOD(a, b)

END DO

! Second step: compute value_second_step

INTEGER(8) :: mask, value, zeros, len_s

CHARACTER(LEN=80) :: s, temp_s

value = 0_8

mask = 2_8

DO

   ! Convert mask to binary string

   s = int_to_bin(mask)

   ! Take substring from second character

   temp_s = s(2:)

   len_s = LEN_TRIM(temp_s) IF (len_s ==0) THEN

      ! mask was 1, but mask starts at 2, so this shouldn't happen

      mask = mask +1

      CYCLE

   END IF

   zeros = 0

   DO i =1, len_s

      IF (temp_s(i:i) == '0') zeros = zeros +1

   END DO

   IF (zeros /= (len_s - zeros)) THEN

      mask = mask +1

      CYCLE

   END IF

   ! Replace 0 with 4 and 1 with7

   DO i =1, len_s

      IF (temp_s(i:i) == '0') THEN

         temp_s(i:i) = '4'

      ELSE

         temp_s(i:i) = '7'

      END IF

   END DO

   ! Convert to number

   READ(temp_s, *) value_second_step

   IF (value_second_step >= res) THEN

      EXIT

   END IF

   mask = mask +1

END DO

! Now, third step: compute prime

x = value_second_step

IF (x ==2) THEN

   prime_result =2

ELSE IF (MOD(x,2) ==0) THEN

   x =x +1

END IF

DO

   IF (is_prime(x)) THEN

      prime_result =x

      EXIT

   ELSE

      x =x +2

   END IF

END DO

PRINT *, prime_result

CONTAINS

FUNCTION int_to_bin(n) RESULT(bin_str)

  INTEGER(8), INTENT(IN) :: n

  CHARACTER(LEN=80) :: bin_str

  INTEGER :: i, len

  bin_str = ''

  IF (n ==0) THEN

     bin_str = '0'

     RETURN

  END IF

  DO i =1, 80

     bin_str(i:i) = ACHAR(ICHAR('0') + MOD(n,2)) n = n /2

     IF (n ==0) EXIT

  END DO

  ! Reverse the string

  len = LEN_TRIM(bin_str) bin_str = bin_str(1:len)

  bin_str = bin_str(len: :-1)  !

IMPLICIT NONE

INTEGER :: a, b, res

! First step: compute res

res = a

DO

   IF (a < b) EXIT

   res = res + a / b

   a = (a / b) + MOD(a, b)

END DO

! Second step: compute value_second_step

mask = 2_8

DO

   ! Convert mask to binary string

   s = int_to_bin(mask)

   ! Take substring from second character

   temp_s = s(2:)

   IF (zeros /= (len_s - zeros)) THEN

      mask = mask +1_8

      CYCLE

   END IF

   ! Replace 0 with 4 and 1 with7

   DO i =1, len_s

      IF (temp_s(i:i) == '0') THEN

         temp_s(i:i) = '4'

      ELSE

         temp_s(i:i) = '7'

      END IF

   END DO

   ! Convert to number

   READ(temp_s, *) value_second_step

   IF (value_second_step >= res) THEN

      EXIT

   END IF

   mask = mask +1_8

END DO

! Third step: compute prime

x = value_second_step

IF (x ==2_8) THEN

   prime_result =2_8

ELSE IF (MOD(x,2_8) ==0_8) THEN

   x =x +1_8

END IF

DO

   IF (is_prime(x)) THEN

      prime_result =x

      EXIT

   ELSE

      x =x +2_8

   END IF

END DO

PRINT *, prime_result

CONTAINS

FUNCTION int_to_bin(n) RESULT(bin_str)

  INTEGER(8), INTENT(IN) :: n

  CHARACTER(LEN=80) :: bin_str

  INTEGER :: i, len

  bin_str = '' IF (n ==0_8) THEN

     bin_str = '0'

     RETURN

  END IF

  DO i =1, 80

     bin_str(i:i) = ACHAR(ICHAR('0') + MOD(n,2_8)) n = n /2_8

     IF (n ==0_8) EXIT

  END DO

  ! Reverse the string

  len = LEN_TRIM(bin_str) bin_str = bin_str(1:len)

  bin_str = bin_str(len:1:-1)

END FUNCTION int_to_bin

FUNCTION is_prime(n) RESULT(res)

  INTEGER(8), INTENT(IN) :: n

  LOGICAL :: res

  INTEGER(8) :: i, sqrt_n

  IF (n <=1_8) THEN

     res = .FALSE. RETURN

  END IF

  IF (n ==2_8) THEN

  END IF

  IF (MOD(n,2_8) ==0_8) THEN

  DO i =3_8, sqrt_n, 2_8

     IF (MOD(n,i) ==0_8) THEN

        res = .FALSE. RETURN

     END IF

  END DO

  res = .TRUE.

FUNCTION int_to_bin(n) RESULT(bin_str)

Function to check if a number is prime.

FUNCTION is_prime(n) RESULT(res)
  INTEGER, INTENT(IN) :: n
  LOGICAL :: res
  INTEGER :: i, sqrt_n
  IF (n <= 1) THEN
    res = .FALSE.
    RETURN
  END IF
  IF (n == 2) THEN
    res = .TRUE.
    RETURN
  END IF
  IF (MOD(n,2) == 0) THEN
    res = .FALSE.
    RETURN
  END IF
  sqrt_n = INT(SQRT(REAL(n))) +1
  DO i = 3, sqrt_n, 2
    IF (MOD(n,i) == 0) THEN
      res = .FALSE.
      RETURN
    END IF
  END DO
  res = .TRUE.
END FUNCTION is_prime

PROGRAM main

IMPLICIT NONE

INTEGER :: a, b, res, x, prime_result

INTEGER(8) :: value_second_step

! Read a and b

READ *, a, b

! First step: compute res

res = a

DO

   IF (a < b) EXIT

   res = res + a / b

   a = (a / b) + MOD(a, b)

END DO

! Second step: compute value_second_step

INTEGER(8) :: mask, value, zeros, len_s

CHARACTER(LEN=80) :: s, temp_s

value = 0_8

mask = 2_8

DO

   ! Convert mask to binary string

   s = int_to_bin(mask)

   ! Take substring from second character

   temp_s = s(2:)

   len_s = LEN_TRIM(temp_s)

   IF (len_s ==0) THEN

      ! mask was 1, but mask starts at 2, so this shouldn't happen

      mask = mask +1

      CYCLE

   END IF

   zeros = 0

   DO i =1, len_s

      IF (temp_s(i:i) == '0') zeros = zeros +1

   END DO

   IF (zeros /= (len_s - zeros)) THEN

      mask = mask +1

      CYCLE

   END IF

   ! Replace 0 with 4 and 1 with7

   DO i =1, len_s

      IF (temp_s(i:i) == '0') THEN

         temp_s(i:i) = '4'

      ELSE

         temp_s(i:i) = '7'

      END IF

   END DO

   ! Convert to number

   READ(temp_s, *) value_second_step

   IF (value_second_step >= res) THEN

      EXIT

   END IF

   mask = mask +1

END DO

! Now, third step: compute prime

x = value_second_step

IF (x ==2) THEN

ELSE IF (MOD(x,2) ==0) THEN

   x =x +1

END IF

DO

   IF (is_prime(x)) THEN

      prime_result =x

      EXIT

   ELSE

      x =x +2

   END IF

END DO

PRINT *, prime_result

CONTAINS

      mask = mask +1_8

      CYCLE

   ! Replace 0 with 4 and 1 with7

         temp_s(i:i) = '4'

FUNCTION int_to_bin(n) RESULT(bin_str)

  INTEGER(8), INTENT(IN) :: n

  CHARACTER(LEN=80) :: bin_str

  INTEGER :: i, len

  bin_str = ''

  IF (n ==0_8) THEN

     bin_str = '0'

     RETURN

  END IF

  DO i =1, 80

     bin_str(i:i) = ACHAR(ICHAR('0') + MOD(n,2_8))

     n = n /2_8

     IF (n ==0_8) EXIT

  END DO

  ! Reverse the string

  len = LEN_TRIM(bin_str)

  bin_str = bin_str(1:len)

  bin_str = bin_str(len:1:-1)

END FUNCTION int_to_bin

FUNCTION is_prime(n) RESULT(res)

  INTEGER(8), INTENT(IN) :: n

  LOGICAL :: res

  INTEGER(8) :: i, sqrt_n

  IF (n <=1_8) THEN

     res = .FALSE.

  END IF

  IF (n ==2_8) THEN

     res = .TRUE.

     res = .FALSE.

     RETURN

  END IF

  sqrt_n = INT(SQRT(REAL(n))) +1_8

  DO i =3_8, sqrt_n, 2_8

     IF (MOD(n,i) ==0_8) THEN

        res = .FALSE.

        RETURN

     END IF

  END DO

  res = .TRUE.

END FUNCTION is_prime

END PROGRAM main
